Event.name: Intercepting
Event.definition:
<def-root>A volitionally acting <fen>Interceptor</fen> takes control, without being authorized to do so by the sender, of a <fen>Theme</fen> that is underway from a sender to a recipient. The <fen>Interceptor</fen> (or somebody on whose behalf they act) believes that the <fen>Theme</fen> reaching its goal would be against their interest.
The <fen>Theme</fen> may be a physical thing that is being conveyed, a self-moving entity, or information that is broadcast.
<ex><fex name="Interceptor">Police</fex> <t>intercepted</t> <fex name="Theme">the call</fex> and raided the address.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">The vessel</fex> got <t>intercepted</t> <fex name="Place">in the Mediterranean</fex> <fex name="Interceptor">by the German navy</fex> .</ex>
<ex><fex name="Interceptor">A Royal Navy frigate</fex> <t>intercepted</t> <fex name="Theme">his yacht</fex> <fex name="pla">off Gibraltar</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Interceptor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The volitional agent who without authorization of sender or recipient takes control of a <fen>Theme</fen> that is en route to a destination.
<ex> Two days later, <fex name="int">an aerial patrol</fex> <t>intercepted</t> an enemy trying the same thing.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The entity, physical or abstract, construed as traveling from a sender to a goal location, which is taken hold of by the <fen>Interceptor</fen> without permission.
<ex>They could either sail west down the Channel or north-east to <t>intercept</t> <fex name="the">an enemy making for the Thames estuary</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the <fen>Interceptor</fen> takes control of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>She had been <t>intercepted</t> <fex name="pla">outside Guy 's room</fex> and would be severely punished.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Interceptor</fen> takes control of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>The five had been <t>intercepted</t> <fex name="tim">after a DFLP attack on March 5</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the intercepting event as being in some state during the action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the Intercepting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably</ment>, <ment>presumably</ment>, <ment>mysteriously</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate also salient characteristics of the <fen>Interceptor</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>With the help of John Poindexter, I've <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex> <t>intercepted</t> communications from cycling's best and brightest.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The circumstances under which the interception takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs that the <fen>Interceptor</fen> hopes to bring about by intercepting.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action performed by the <fen>Interceptor</fen> that results in success.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: intercept.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: obstruct and prevent from continuing to a destination
